In late November 1758, the French, believing the British would not strike until spring, evacuated Fort Duquesne after destroying their cannon. Washington and his vanguard marched in on November 25, 1758, and raised the British flag on the ruins, renaming it Fort Pitt. This event concluded five years of conflict to secure the Forks of the Ohio, with peace established between the British and local Indian tribes.
